page.title: 01The area around Bradhaven
page.content: As Bride's Bay comprises almost half the block. The coastline runs NS here; there is a wide sandy beach at Broadhaven, with cliffs to the north. They are 50-8 metres high & sheer. The countryside inland undulates quite gently-average highest above sea-level is c. 75 metres, maximum c.110 metres. There is uncultivated land at the cliff edges-heather, some bracken, gorse, coarse grass. Otherwise, land is cultivated rough grazing for dairy cattle. Very little woodland-one small area near Broadhaven. B4341 and several minor roads run through the block. Well developed hedgerows bramble and hawthorn; good variety of hedgerow flowers. Rural area-3 small villages, older than Broadhaven. Based on dairy farming the main land use. Tourism is the other main industry here Broadhaven exists mainly
